thread.title: Get into spooky spirit with Boo at the Zoo
thread.title_full: Get into spooky spirit with Boo at the Zoo

title: Get into spooky spirit with Boo at the Zoo
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Get into spooky spirit with Boo at the Zoo The bootiful fall weather has allowed the Little Rock Zoo to kick off its Halloween festivities with a bang. Post to Facebook Get into spooky spirit with Boo at the Zoo The bootiful fall weather has allowed the Little Rock Zoo to kick off its Halloween festivities with a bang.  //on.kthv.com/1RQVj5f   Join the Conversation To   Get into spooky spirit with Boo at the Zoo The Little Rock Zoo kicked off their annual Boo at the Zoo this weekend. THV11.com 10/18/15 KTHV THV 11 Staff, news source 11:31 p.m. CDT October 18, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (KTHV) - The bootiful fall weather has allowed the Little Rock Zoo to kick off its Halloween festivities with a bang. 
The Little Rock Zoo has begun its 24th Annual Boo at the Zoo event, creating special nights for all ages to enjoy. Children who visit can expect a Haunted Train and House, trick-or-treat stations supplied with candy and toys, Frankenstein's Dance Party, games, free s'mores with every ticket, a hay maze, face painting and much more. 
Boo at the Zoo opened its doors to the public on October 17 and 18 and will continue to welcome all ghosts and ghouls starting October 23 and will remain open until October 31. 
To appeal to all ages groups, Boo at the Zoo held their Adult Night on Friday for Ages 21 and up. With a wristband, they got to enjoy adult beverages at trick-or-treat stations as well as check out some of the games and attractions without the kids by their side. More special themed nights include: 
Teen Night on Oct. 16: 
For the first time, Boo at the Zoo will also feature a Teen Night on October 16. Those in grades 7th through 12th can present their student ID's for entry. Chaperone tickets are also available at a discounted price for this event, and the Zoo has added extra security on this night to ensure that teens have a safe and fun experience. Tickets for Teen Night are $20 per person and chaperone tickets are $10 per person. LIST: Haunted houses, forests, hay rides, and more in 2015 
Dia de los Muertos Oct. 30: 
In honor of the traditional Hispanic holiday, Dia de los Muertos, the Little Rock Zoo has partnered with Hola! Arkansas to host a special Boo at the Zoo on Oct. 30. The rich culture of Dia de los Muertos will be showcased by members of Hola! Arkansas, who will set up a special altar in honor of deceased relatives - a tradition of many Hispanic families celebrating this holiday that normally falls on Nov. 1. This special night of Boo at the Zoo will also feature Hispanic dancers and performers. All regular Boo at the Zoo activities and events will also be available, and the event is open to the public. 
Ticket Info: $20 per person for wristband admission, which includes all rides, attractions and six tickets for trick-or-treat stations and s'mores $10 General Admission and includes six tickets that may be used for trick-or-treat stations, s'mores, or for rides and attractions. Rides and attractions take between two and 10 tickets. Individual tickets for rides, attractions, treat stations and s'mores are also sold inside the Zoo for $.50 each and guests purchasing General Admission tickets also have the option to upgrade to a wristband if they chose. 
Admission passes can be purchased online at www.LittleRockZoo.com/boo or at the Zoo's front gate entrance. 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 2015 Boo at the Zoo THV11 Like this topic?
